comment:
* BuildInfo is a utility class providing easy access to {@link PackageInfo} information. This is
 * primarily of use for accessing package information from native code.

variables.name: hostPackageName
variables.comment:
* The package name of the host app which has loaded WebView, retrieved from the application
     * context. In the context of the SDK Runtime, the package name of the app that owns this
     * particular instance of the SDK Runtime will also be included.
     * e.g. com.google.android.sdksandbox:com:com.example.myappwithads

variables.name: hostPackageLabel
variables.comment:
* The application name (e.g. "Chrome"). For WebView, this is name of the embedding app.
     * In the context of the SDK Runtime, this is the name of the app that owns this particular
     * instance of the SDK Runtime.

variables.name: hostVersionCode
variables.comment:
* By default: same as versionCode. For WebView: versionCode of the embedding app.
     * In the context of the SDK Runtime, this is the versionCode of the app that owns this
     * particular instance of the SDK Runtime.

variables.name: packageName
variables.comment:
* The packageName of Chrome/WebView. Use application context for host app packageName.
     * Same as the host information within any child process.

variables.name: versionName
variables.comment: The versionName of Chrome/WebView. Use application context for host app versionName.

variables.name: installerPackageName
variables.comment: Result of PackageManager.getInstallerPackageName(). Never null, but may be "".

variables.name: gmsVersionCode
variables.comment: The versionCode of Play Services (for crash reporting).

variables.name: androidBuildFingerprint
variables.comment: Truncated version of Build.FINGERPRINT (for crash reporting).

variables.name: customThemes
variables.comment: Whether or not the device has apps installed for using custom themes.

variables.name: resourcesVersion
variables.comment: Product version as stored in Android resources.

variables.name: isTV
variables.comment: Whether we're running on Android TV or not

variables.name: isAutomotive
variables.comment: Whether we're running on an Android Automotive OS device or not.

variables.name: isFoldable
variables.comment: Whether we're running on an Android Foldable OS device or not.

variables.name: vulkanDeqpLevel
variables.comment: * version of the FEATURE_VULKAN_DEQP_LEVEL, if available. Queried only on Android T or above

methods.name: private String[] getAllProperties()
methods.comment: Returns a serialized string array of all properties of this class.

methods.name: public static long packageVersionCode(PackageInfo pi)
methods.comment:
* Return the "long" version code of the given PackageInfo.
     * Does the right thing for before/after Android P when this got wider.

methods.name: public static void setBrowserPackageInfo(PackageInfo packageInfo)
methods.comment: * @param packageInfo Package for Chrome/WebView (as opposed to host app).

methods.name: public ApplicationInfo getBrowserApplicationInfo()
methods.comment: * @return ApplicationInfo for Chrome/WebView (as opposed to host app).

methods.name: public static boolean isDebugAndroid()
methods.comment:
* Check if this is a debuggable build of Android.
     * This is a rough approximation of the hidden API {@code Build.IS_DEBUGGABLE}.

methods.name: public static boolean isDebugApp()
methods.comment:
* Check if the app is declared debuggable in its manifest.
     * In WebView, this refers to the host app.

methods.name: public static boolean isDebugAndroidOrApp()
methods.comment:
* Check if this is either a debuggable build of Android or of the host app.
     * Use this to enable developer-only features.

methods.name: public static boolean targetsAtLeastT()
methods.comment:
* Checks if the application targets the T SDK or later.
     * @deprecated Chrome callers should just remove this test - Chrome targets T or later now.
     * WebView callers should just inline the logic below to check the target level of the embedding
     * App when necessary.

methods.name: public static boolean targetsAtLeastU()
methods.comment:
* Checks if the application targets pre-release SDK U.
     * This must be manually maintained as the SDK goes through finalization!
     * Avoid depending on this if possible; this is only intended for WebView.
